snippet: While public attention has been fixed on the Middle East, Secretary of State John Kerry has started a push to create an agencywide focus on global warming.
abstract: Secretary of State John Kerry's goal is to become the lead broker of a global climate treaty in 2015 that will commit the United States and other nations to historic reductions in fossil fuel pollution; while public attention has been fixed on the Middle East, he has quietly initiated a systematic, top-down push to create an agencywide focus on global warming; whether he can have that kind of influence remains an open question.
lead_paragraph: While public attention has been fixed on the Middle East, Secretary of State John Kerry has started a push to create an agencywide focus on global warming.

headline.main: Kerry Quietly Makes Priority of Climate Pact
headline.print_headline: Kerry Making Pact on Climate A Top Priority
